title: Psalms 55:1
text: GIVE ear to my prayer, O God; and hide not thyself from my supplication.

title: Psalms 55:2
text: Attend unto me, and hear me: I mourn in my complaint, and make a noise;

title: Psalms 55:3
text: Because of the voice of the enemy, because of the oppression of the wicked: for they cast iniquity upon me, and in wrath they hate me.

title: Psalms 55:4
text: My heart is sore pained within me: and the terrors of death are fallen upon me.

title: Psalms 55:5
text: Fearfulness and trembling are come upon me, and horror hath overwhelmed me.

title: Psalms 55:6
text: And I said, Oh that I had wings like a dove!  for then would I fly away, and be at rest.

title: Psalms 55:7
text: Lo, then would I wander far off, and remain in the wilderness.  Selah.

title: Psalms 55:8
text: I would hasten my escape from the windy storm and tempest.

title: Psalms 55:9
text: Destroy, O Lord, and divide their tongues: for I have seen violence and strife in the city.

title: Psalms 55:10
text: Day and night they go about it upon the walls thereof: mischief also and sorrow are in the midst of it.

title: Psalms 55:11
text: Wickedness is in the midst thereof: deceit and guile depart not from her streets.

title: Psalms 55:12
text: For it was not an enemy that reproached me; then I could have borne it: neither was it he that hated me that did magnify himself against me; then I would have hid myself from him:

title: Psalms 55:13
text: But it was thou, a man mine equal, my guide, and mine acquaintance.

title: Psalms 55:14
text: We took sweet counsel together, and walked unto the house of God in company.

title: Psalms 55:15
text: Let death seize upon them, and let them go down quick into hell: for wickedness is in their dwellings, and among them.

title: Psalms 55:16
text: As for me, I will call upon God; and the LORD shall save me.

title: Psalms 55:17
text: Evening, and morning, and at noon, will I pray, and cry aloud: and he shall hear my voice.

title: Psalms 55:18
text: He hath delivered my soul in peace from the battle that was against me: for there were many with me.

title: Psalms 55:19
text: God shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old.  Selah.  Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.

title: Psalms 55:20
text: He hath put forth his hands against such as be at peace with him: he hath broken his covenant.

title: Psalms 55:21
text: The words of his mouth were smoother than butter, but war was in his heart: his words were softer than oil, yet were they drawn swords.

title: Psalms 55:22
text: Cast thy burden upon the LORD, and he shall sustain thee: he shall never suffer the righteous to be moved.

title: Psalms 55:23
text: But thou, O God, shalt bring them down into the pit of destruction: bloody and deceitful men shall not live out half their days; but I will trust in thee.
